values: Men are overrated.  I can do most everything I want to do romantically or sexually with a woman that I can do with a man as long as we have the right accessories.  Men can be accessorized, sure, but there is still a thing or two that I can't do with a guy.  What does this mean?  While I'm not philosophically opposed to guys, I will probably stick to women.

The Book of Edge: Being One Leatherman's Journey
By LTHR EDGE

I can't explain it.  I just love it.

These five notes were written at various different times over the past two weeks:

Angst is like scraping my heart with a spork.  Not digging it out and frying it with cilantro, but slowly scraping away at it, until I'm tearing my hair out, drowning in tears, and begging for someone to locate a spatula and toss on the proper seasonings.

I would really like to see a fanfic writer write the missing scenes plus extras for everything - with the same backstory foundation by starting at the beginning of the show all the way to the present.  By this I mean, no matter if you stick to cannon or prefer some set of ships or whatever, I love these characters and sometimes would like to know more about them, but in a regular character growth way.  Like, they don't show every mission, what else happpens?  Sometimes we see an entire timeframe from only one person's point of view, what are other people thinking and experiencing?  How do people interact off base?  What are the stories of the reoccuring, but somewhat minor characters?  What caused this character to do something fans consider to be "out of character"?  Sometimes the show makes reference to events that have never been featured on the show - like the discovery of some down-the-food-chain team - what are the details of that situation?  If you give me the happily ever after at the end of Story 1, that's great - but what happens after the happily ever after, when work and life and loss and other such complications come into play?  On the one hand, I would like to see this because I want some plot holes filled, but I would also like to see if it can even be done.  Would it be possible, say, to start with a basic premise about the formation of some pairing (cannon/fannon/whatever) "off-air" and make your fic a sort of extension of the show, such that someone could see how each plays off the other.  It's like, Buffy and Angel were originally aired back to back and since they inhabit the same world and share some social ties, occasionally activity in one show would leak into the next.  You can certainly see Buffy eps that were affectd by Angel eps without seeing the relevant Angel eps and vice versa, but the eps take on new meaning when set them beside each other, despite the fact that they stand alone ok.  I want a massive fic series that just lets me spend more quality time with the characters I love.  If certain ships were to fall into place during that process, well, wouldn't that just be dandy.

I am way more picky about grammar than I should be, especially considering how little I care about it when I'm writing something.  Observe what I have come across in my readings that makes me go omgwtfbbq!:
Uh huh = yes
uh uh = no
nuh uh = no
huh uh = ?
nuh huh = ?
yeehaw = wee! yippee! ride 'em cowboy!
yoohaw = ?

Moral of the Story (specifically, A Mad Wind by Mitch H.):  Never leave your favorite archaeologist alone with a homophobic neo-nazi satanist special ops marine, but a cultured special ops marine who was recently released from a lifetime of leatherman slavery is okay, probably.

What do you get when you bring together Jean-Luc Picard, the USS Voyager, jedi knights, immortals with swords, heightened senses, the SGC's best Stargate team, and Greek mythology?  Apparently, an orgy of multi-galactic proportions, or so says one fanfiction author.  Ridiculous as this might sound, it still seems, IMHO, to be a better story concept than Harry Potter/JC Chasez.  Though I never thought of it this way before, I honestly think the internet is the funniest invention ever.

I don't know what I want or even how to figure it out.  Part of me wants connections, part of me wants independence, part of me wants relations, part of me wants silence.  I don't know who it is that is speaking inside my head sometimes.  I mean, I feel torn up like two parts of me are fighting each other and drawing blood.  I don't know where to go from here.  I don't even know where here is exactly.  On the one hand, there are people I feel that I can talk to about anything, on the other hand, it seems that no one is ever really listening.  I don't want people to be psychic, but I don't always like being a mystery.  The problem is, of course, though, that I'm a mystery to myself sometimes, so how on earth could anyone else figure me out.

Sorry, I haven't posted in some time ... not that you care ... whoever you are out there reading this journal ... my non-friends ... who happen to hit random on their livejournal searching path, hoping to find juicey tidbits from highschoolers hollering about who has a crush on who and who joni or billy or skye or matthew is going to ask to the dance ... who are you ... I don't know you ... why do you care about my particular predicament ... as if we're friends ... do you enjoy your voyeuristic romp into my private life ... thought I invited you in ... its like I invite you because ii know you are nearly harmless and I need a little less harm in my life right now ... 


i realized a few days ago that i've had little physical human contact ... and that's surprisingly fine with me ... while on the one hand, I know that I am numb because my brain is overloaded ... i also know that I'm numb because i'vm completely uninterested in most things ... and that's okay with me ... 


think about it like this ... if i were to take a massive break right now, like take off next semester, then all I would do would be to veg out ... you know ... read all the books in a particular genre, starting from A authors and going to Z authors ... then I'd watch all the seasons of all the popular TV shows that i've missed being a fabulous student and organization member.  I would love to be able to say right now that i deserved this break ... but all I can say is that I'm going to have a nervous breakdown without one ... my body and my brain are both intensely yelling at me to get a grip on my life ...


but i also feel that if i slow down, i may never want to be engaged and active part of society again ... but then i think about how little i'm actually contributing right now because i'm so burnt out and I just keep thinking that maybe if I could just i don't know reconfigure things that I would be able to bounce back and be my old energized self right now ... i feel absolutely terrible ... all the time ... and i know that part of me feeling terrible is the lack of care i have, right now, for anything ... i absolutely despise the life outside my bedroom ... i just want to crawl under my desk and hide from life ... i can't take this any more ... 


i need help, in some mental medical sense ... but i also can't bring myself to scream for help ... i just run ... and run ... and collapse ... and shirk my duties ... and hate myself for being a terripble person who no one can depend on ... but then ... then I wake up ... and i realize that i'm not dreaming ... i really am a horrible person who has done so little for the organizations I thought I really gave a damn about ... 

my chances and choices are dyin g with my heart ...

i've burned out... i'm dead to the world ... 

nothing you or anyone can say will bring me back from this edge ...
i'm already falling into the abyss and the only thing that will stop me is if I somehow magically grew wings
let me go away froor a while ... let me figure this out ... let me get my mind in working order ... let me organize my information let me organize my materials ... then, only then, will i be able to come back rested, rejuvinated, ready to face the world with a strong stride and a strong heart ... i'm faking it right now ... i'm faking all of this ... i'm eating myself alive ... i'm drowning in my own blood ... i'm beating my own mind to death with a sledgehammer ... and i'm smiling the way that nervous people giggle, because nothing is funny but they just can't help themselves ... i need ot find a home for my mind ... a mental rest home ... where i can regain my focus ... 


STAY FOCUSED!!@!!!!!!!!!


I can't, all I can focus on is the hurt i feel inside and the vast numbness, its like i could die tomorrow and that owuld at least be a sensation ... this numbness, it scares me thoughtI know it protects me ... it scares me because I feel that I own't know what my weak spot is until it's sprung a leak, but as for now ... I just can't feel anything ... 

help me ... please ... i beg you ... i don't know what else i can do ... i just don't want to dight a mass of nervless part

Why does it bother me so much that he's leaving?  I feel like we have been closer than we really have been.  I don't know quite what's come over me.  It's like every time I see him and know that he's leaving, I find myself on the verge of tears.  He left me a fine paper, that I am to bind for the House.  I feel as if I am losing a deeper friend than I knew I had.  He is a kindred spirit who understands my frantic writing desires and my grand plans for the organization.  He loves the debate in meetings, as I do, if only to know that everyone is voting with a clear understanding of the issues at hand.  He is a mental maverick, clearing out unpaved paths to get to unknown destinations.  He has been Core, holding the House with me and now he leaves us all to go on to bigger and better things.  He makes me cringe at the height of his genious and leaves me bitter at the thought of his absence.  Why did I never get to know him?  Why do I feel almost as if we could be better friends now than ever before?  What is the doubt I see in his eyes?  He doubts himself, feeling that he is over-accoladed, that he is somehow yet unworthy of all the splendid praise.  I know, though, that he is everything and will be everything that his teachers, advisors, family, and friends have set before him as a challenge to hurtle gracefully in his future.  He will be the man we were glad to have as a housemate and as a friend.

I am losing the Label War. I can believe in an ideology that despises labels and labeling theory, but in our society we are constantly bombarded by labels and forced to choose. Daily, I attempt to live up to my label-free theories but inevitably I am asked where I fall or I am ascribed a particular label by others.

Most people concede that personal identity is a conglomeration of various identities. One cannot just be a particular ethnic identity, a particualr gender, or a particular sexuality, rather, it is important to take into account so many of the other ways in which human beings may vary, in an attempt to label the whole of oneself. Yet, there is something in the way that these identitties are combined in the current hegemony that makes them difficult to define in other combinations. For example, it seems incongruous to have a rap-listener who is upper class, white, christian, heterosexual, and even though it seems natural to have a rap-listener be urban, black, nonreligious or baptist, and heterosexual.

Yet, few people are willing to admit that each of these identity categories can be infinitely more complex, such that being solely white, solely upper-class, or solely christian doesn't cut it, perhaps one is an ethnic white (perhaps italian), grew up working class, and participates in a unique sect of christianity. I have such difficulty with labelling theory because it decimates these important elements in favor of succinctness, such that this process is truly ridiculous. This is labelling theories fatal flaw, it forces me to choose only one term to encompass each category of my identity.

It's about wild and crazy times, fast hits at Ridgemont High, it's my life, online, it's ME.

So I started an online journal today, to tell the world my deepest darkests and I am not quite sure why, but I thought I should share - hell, everyone else is.

Let's begin, shall we, from the start.

I am against people-labels - meaning all the labels that we use to classify ourselves and each other. No matter what labels we choose, others will interpret them differently than we do.

Labelling is a process of self-stereotyping wherein we choose labels that most closely fit our view of ourselves, then attempt to live up to the character of the label or spend our lives explaining the particular nuances of ourselves to everyone who interprets our label differently.

I see announcements everyday about what good _____ people should do. Good black people should support affirmative action. Good female people should be pro-choice. Good gay people should vote democrat. Good liberal people should hate Bush. Good _____ people should do ... should do ... should fucking shed their blanks and just try to be Good People period.

No label or combination of labels can adequately describe me as a person and although I appreciate membership in those groups that ascribe to this method of self-stereotyping - black, bisexual, woman, liberal, democrat, etc. - it would take me longer to explain myself through labels than to list everything I am, think, and feel and I am sure that there would be many contradicting labels.

Beyond that, since there is no real standard labelling formula, even knowing everything about myself, I am unsure which label really applies where.

For an ethnicity example - I am 1/16th French, 3/16ths Cherokee, 11/16ths African (Black American), and 1/16th some combination of Blackfoot & English. Most people label me as "Black" from my mahogany skin and nappy hair, but that doesn't really describe the complexity of my heritage nor does it adequetly describe the communities in which I actively participate. Do I need to wear a sign over my head or correct people with my own convoluted label, perhaps in the tradition of Tiger Woods' Cablasian? Should I say I am Frablafricheranglish so that I can explain the complexity of my ethnic identity?

What I mean is that if someone, namely me, does not fit neatly into labels, the traditional reaction is for them to find the label that "fits best" which is always an oversimplification of their identity, but as our country becomes more "mixed" (in every sense of the word), there are new labels appearing every week, on surveys and in conversation. Yet, even these new labels are generalizations that never really get to the meat of the issue - that these labels are totally contrived, sometimes arbitrary, and rarely align with intricacies of a person's identity.

I know that we are a society founded on the ability to classify people into distinct categories, for legal, political, and social reasons, but would it really be so bad if we stopped looking at each other as labels and started looking at each other as people.

I don't want to be chosen or not chosen for anything just because I am thought to fit some label; I want to be known, understood, cared for, loved, because I am the person I am - a person you can never know by reading a list of labels that purport to describe me - a person you can only come to know by sincerely and open-mindedly interacting with me.

I am not a _____ person, there are no labels on me.

I am just a person, as you should be.
